{"step_by_step_thinking": "Nasal antrostomy is a surgical procedure performed to treat maxillary sinusitis. To determine the location from which nasal antrostomy is usually done, we need to analyze the information provided in the relevant documents. Document [4] states that middle meatal antrostomy under nasal endoscope is a functional procedure that provides a new approach to reestablishing the ventilation and drainage of the nasal cavity and paranasal sinus. Document [5] also mentions the middle meatal antrostomy as a treatment of choice for maxillary sinusitis. Based on this information, it can be concluded that nasal antrostomy is usually done through the middle meatus.", "answer_choice": "C. Middle meatus"}
